{"message_number": 107, "author": "Michael K\u00f6lling", "staff": true, "response": "You can enrol in the course with a Year In Industry from the beginning, or you can change into it later. However, enrolling in it from the beginning if you are interested is easier, since changing out of it (going from four to three years) is easier than the other way around. If you decide to go from three to four years later, you will need to adjust student finance, and visa if you are international. So: if you think you might ant to go into industry for a year - which is a great thing to do - enrol in it from the beginning.", "parent": {"author": "Kai", "text": "Can i ask how Year in industry and year abroad works", "message_number": 33}, "children": [114], "full": "<li aria-hidden=\"false\" class=\"_26K5 C0-f\" color=\"default\" data-align=\"left\" data-test-id=\"chat-message-5ebea2586170921c7cd89da1\" style=\"margin-top: 1em; touch-action: pan-y; user-select: none; -webkit-user-drag: none; -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);\"><div class=\"_3-6C C0-f _2lm8\"><div class=\"_2D3v\"><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" fill=\"currentColor\" height=\"1em\" preserveaspectratio=\"xMidYMid meet\" style=\"vertical-align: middle;\" viewbox=\"0 0 40 40\" width=\"1em\"><g><path d=\"m35 31.3c-4.1-7.3-9.5-8-17.5-8v7.2l-12.5-10.5 12.5-11.2v6.2c14.6 0 17.5 16.3 17.5 16.3z\"></path></g></svg></div><div class=\"_33_Z\" data-test-id=\"chat-message-avatar\"><img alt=\"Michael K\u00f6lling\" class=\"_30NT _2pfU\" height=\"45\" src=\"https://images.unibuddy.co/45x45/smart/5ebdbe93f61ae00fa8f50a09.jpg\" width=\"45\"/></div><div class=\"_2KmU\"><div class=\"_3NpR undefined\" data-test-id=\"chat-message-bubble\"><div class=\"_31Bt\">Michael K\u00f6lling</div><div class=\"_3lu9\"><div style=\"border: 0px; clip: rect(0px, 0px, 0px, 0px); height: 1px; width: 1px; margin: -1px; padding: 0px; overflow: hidden; position: absolute;\">They said</div><span><span class=\"_3zCn\">You can enrol in the course with a Year In Industry from the beginning, or you can change into it later. However, enrolling in it from the beginning if you are interested is easier, since changing out of it (going from four to three years) is easier than the other way around. If you decide to go from three to four years later, you will need to adjust student finance, and visa if you are international. {"message_number": 129, "author": "Christian Urban", "staff": true, "response": "These are separate programmes. If you are not already in them, you can transfer up to the second year into them, given good grades in the first two years. Year in industry and year abroad will be in between the 2nd and 3rd year. You will need to find an internship or partner university, but we will help as much as we can. We have a dedicated person who liaises with partners (industry and unis) and we have a long track record in these programmes. So many companies come to use to fill these internships, for example.. {"message_number": 300, "author": "Michael K\u00f6lling", "staff": true, "response": "We use an environment called BlueJ at the beginning, and then let you move on to whatever you like to use. {"message_number": 477, "author": "Michael K\u00f6lling", "staff": true, "response": "That is very hard to say. There is only one module (which is in the first year) that is explicitly about programming. But many other modules require you to learn and practice programming, even though it is not the main topic. For example, you may have a module about Operationg Systems, and you are expected to lean and use C++. Or you have web programming, and you learn and use PHP/Javascript. etc. There are elements of programming in many places, and it is hard to quantify.", "parent": {"author": "Elisabeth Koren", "text": "While taking the Bachelor, what is the approximate weight (percentage of total) of programming with respect to the all a...", "message_number": 429}, "children": [492], "full": "<li aria-hidden=\"false\" class=\"_26K5 C0-f\" color=\"default\" data-align=\"left\" data-test-id=\"chat-message-5ebeadfcfa95ed204260512e\" style=\"margin-top: 1em; touch-action: pan-y; user-select: none; -webkit-user-drag: none; -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);\"><div class=\"_3-6C C0-f _2lm8\"><div class=\"_2D3v\"><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" fill=\"currentColor\" height=\"1em\" preserveaspectratio=\"xMidYMid meet\" style=\"vertical-align: middle;\" viewbox=\"0 0 40 40\" width=\"1em\"><g><path d=\"m35 31.3c-4.1-7.3-9.5-8-17.5-8v7.2l-12.5-10.5 12.5-11.2v6.2c14.6 0 17.5 16.3 17.5 16.3z\"></path></g></svg></div><div class=\"_33_Z\" data-test-id=\"chat-message-avatar\"><img alt=\"Michael K\u00f6lling\" class=\"_30NT _2pfU\" height=\"45\" src=\"https://images.unibuddy.co/45x45/smart/5ebdbe93f61ae00fa8f50a09.jpg\" width=\"45\"/></div><div class=\"_2KmU\"><div class=\"_3NpR undefined\" data-test-id=\"chat-message-bubble\"><div class=\"_31Bt\">Michael K\u00f6lling</div><div class=\"_3lu9\"><div style=\"border: 0px; clip: rect(0px, 0px, 0px, 0px); height: 1px; width: 1px; margin: -1px; padding: 0px; overflow: hidden; position: absolute;\">They said</div><span><span class=\"_3zCn\">That is very hard to say. There is only one module (which is in the first year) that is explicitly about programming. But many other modules require you to learn and practice programming, even though it is not the main topic. For example, you may have a module about Operationg Systems, and you are expected to lean and use C++. Or you have web programming, and you learn and use PHP/Javascript. etc. There are elements of programming in many places, and it is hard to quantify.</span></span></div></div><div class=\"lzXP\"><div class=\"_1lgs\"><button aria-label=\"Reply to message\" class=\"iy4W _2jwX GNrm _3nNl _3IYd _1oud\" data-test-id=\"reply-button\" role=\"button\" type=\"button\"><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" fill=\"currentColor\" height=\"1em\" preserveaspectratio=\"xMidYMid meet\" style=\"vertical-align: middle;\" viewbox=\"0 0 40 40\" width=\"1em\"><g><path d=\"m35 31.3c-4.1-7.3-9.5-8-17.5-8v7.2l-12.5-10.5 12.5-11.2v6.2c14.6 0 17.5 16.3 17.5 16.3z\"></path></g></svg></button></div></div></div></div></li>"}

{"message_number": 494, "author": "Christian Urban", "staff": true, "response": "Our four-year MSci does not come with an option of year-abroad or year-in-industry. This is only for the BScs. In practice you can interrupt your MSci for one year and study abroad. But then it will indeed be 5 years. And the credits obtained abroad do not count towards your MSci degree at King's. Does this help?", "parent": {"author": "Yuto", "text": "^", "message_number": 427}, "children": [], "full": "<li aria-hidden=\"false\" class=\"_26K5 C0-f\" color=\"default\" data-align=\"left\" data-test-id=\"chat-message-5ebeae89dac93e04c1ab2804\" style=\"margin-top: 1em; touch-action: pan-y; user-select: none; -webkit-user-drag: none; -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);\"><div class=\"_3-6C C0-f _2lm8\"><div class=\"_2D3v\"><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" fill=\"currentColor\" height=\"1em\" preserveaspectratio=\"xMidYMid meet\" style=\"vertical-align: middle;\" viewbox=\"0 0 40 40\" width=\"1em\"><g><path d=\"m35 31.3c-4.1-7.3-9.5-8-17.5-8v7.2l-12.5-10.5 12.5-11.2v6.2c14.6 0 17.5 16.3 17.5 16.3z\"></path></g></svg></div><div class=\"_33_Z\" data-test-id=\"chat-message-avatar\"><img alt=\"Christian Urban\" class=\"_30NT _2pfU\" height=\"45\" src=\"https://images.unibuddy.co/45x45/smart/5eba6055f9c9093c766daa34.jpg\" width=\"45\"/></div><div class=\"_2KmU\"><div class=\"_3NpR undefined\" data-test-id=\"chat-message-bubble\"><div class=\"_31Bt\">Christian Urban</div><div class=\"_3lu9\"><div style=\"border: 0px; clip: rect(0px, 0px, 0px, 0px); height: 1px; width: 1px; margin: -1px; padding: 0px; overflow: hidden; position: absolute;\">They said</div><span><span class=\"_3zCn\">Our four-year MSci does not come with an option of year-abroad or year-in-industry. This is only for the BScs. In practice you can interrupt your MSci for one year and study abroad. But then it will indeed be 5 years. And the credits obtained abroad do not count towards your MSci degree at King's. Does this help?</span></span></div></div><div class=\"lzXP\"><div class=\"_1lgs\"><button aria-label=\"Reply to message\" class=\"iy4W _2jwX GNrm _3nNl _3IYd _1oud\" data-test-id=\"reply-button\" role=\"button\" type=\"button\"><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" fill=\"currentColor\" height=\"1em\" preserveaspectratio=\"xMidYMid meet\" style=\"vertical-align: middle;\" viewbox=\"0 0 40 40\" width=\"1em\"><g><path d=\"m35 31.3c-4.1-7.3-9.5-8-17.5-8v7.2l-12.5-10.5 12.5-11.2v6.2c14.6 0 17.5 16.3 17.5 16.3z\"></path></g></svg></button></div></div></div></div></li>"}

{"message_number": 564, "author": "Christian Urban", "staff": true, "response": "In principle you can defer without re-application, but you should not.  The first year is particularly about foundations and programming, which is well-suited for online learning. So instead of wasting one year, students can easily and comfortably complete the material of the first year. If many students defer, then students who complete the first year next year, will be in a much smaller market for internships, for example, which are usually scheduled between first and second year. And also big tech companies like Facebook and Google have not ceased to hiring people.
